original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Numerical Order of the Categories of Phenomena in the Book of Conditional Relations

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽20.8. Piṭṭhiduka
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma  piṭṭhiduka
translated: The Pairs🔽With the condition being a phenomenon that is to be given up through vision, there arises a phenomenon that is to be given up through vision. (One condition.)

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.🔽Nanadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nanadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nanadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo ca nadassanena pahātabbo🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  nana dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ ca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With the condition being a phenomenon that is to be given up through cultivation, there arises a phenomenon that is to be given up through vision.🔽With the condition being a phenomenon that is to be given up through cultivation, there arises a phenomenon that is to be given up through vision.🔽With the condition being a phenomenon that is to be given up through cultivation, there arises a phenomenon that is to be given up through vision and a phenomenon that is to be given up through cultivation. (Three conditions.)

original: Nadassanena pahātabbañca nanadassanena pahātabbañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbañca na na dassanena pahātabbañca dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the condition being a phenomenon that is to be given up through vision and a phenomenon that is to be given up through cultivation, there arises a phenomenon that is to be given up through cultivation. (One condition.) (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: With the condition being a cause, there are five. With the condition being an object, there are two. With the condition being nutriment, there are four. With the condition being a jhāna, there are two. With the condition being a path, there are two. With the condition being a fruition, there is one. With the condition being an attainment, there is one. With the condition being a birth, there are two. With the condition being an existence, there are two. With the condition being an occurrence, there are two. With the condition being an entanglement, there are two. With the condition being a pursuit, there are two. With the condition being a bond, there are two. With the condition being a grasping, there are two. With the condition being a flood, there are two. With the condition being a dart, there are two. With the condition being a hindrance, there are two. With the condition being a tie, there are two. With the condition being a latent tendency, there are two. With the condition being a wrong view, there are two. With the condition being a cling ing

original: Nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is to be abandoned by vision of states, a state that is to be abandoned by vision of states arises with which cause as condition? (In brief:)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca  na dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: In the section on cause there are five; in the section on object, two; … in the section on result, one; … in the section on non-hindrance, five.🔽Dependent on a state that is not to be abandoned by vision of states, a state that is to be abandoned by vision of states arises with which cause as condition? (In brief:)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava
translated: In the section on cause there are nine; in the section on object, six; in the section on predominance, five; … in the section on result, one; … in the section on non-hindrance, nine.

original: Nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is not to be abandoned by mental development, a state that is to be abandoned by mental development arises with which cause as condition? (In brief:)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava.🔽Nasavitakkaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasavitakkaṁ
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava 🔽na sa vitakkam dhammam paṭicca sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa vitakka

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasavitakkaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa vitakkam dhammam paṭicca  sa vitakko ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A state without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support condition, for a state without thinking.🔽A state with thinking and a state without thinking are conditions, as a condition by way of decisive support condition, for a state with thinking. … three.

original: Naavitakkaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naavitakkaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca savitakko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naavitakkaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakko🔽ca avitakko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nasavitakkañca naavitakkañca dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na avitakkam dhammam paṭicca avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na avitakkam dhamma  paṭicca sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na avitakkam dhammam paṭicca sa vitakkaḥ  ca avitakko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  na sa vitakkam ca na avitakkañca dhammam paṭicca sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state without thinking. A state without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking. A state without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking and without thinking. A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking. A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state without thinking. A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking and without thinking. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nasavitakkañca naavitakkañca dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nasavitakkañca naavitakkañca dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: na sa vitakkam ca na avitakkañca dhammam paṭicca avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na sa vitakkam ca na avitakkam ca dhammam paṭicca sa vitakkaḥ ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti
translated: A state without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state without thinking. A state without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking. A state without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking and without thinking. A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking. A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state without thinking. A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking and without thinking. (Abbreviated.)

original: hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking. A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state without thinking. A state with thinking and without thinking is a condition, as a condition by way of decisive support, for a state with thinking and without thinking.

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… purejāte āsevane cha …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe purejāte āsevane cha pe avigate nava
translated: Nine in the cause … Nine in the object … Six in the prenascent … Six in the postnascent … Nine in the unarisen … Nine in the unarisen and in the presently arisen … Nine in the past and future … Nine in the past and present … Nine in the future and present … Nine in the past, future, and present.

original: Nasavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savicāro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sa vicāram dhammam paṭicca sa vicāraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With non-applied-thought dhamma as condition, applied-thought dhamma arises, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… purejāte āsevane cha …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe purejāte āsevane cha pe avigate nava
translated: Nine in the cause … Nine in the object … Six in the prenascent … Six in the postnascent … Nine in the unarisen … Nine in the unarisen and in the presently arisen … Nine in the past and future … Nine in the past and present … Nine in the future and present … Nine in the past, future, and present.

original: Nasappītikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sappītiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sa ppītikam dhammam paṭicca sa ppītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With non-rapture dhamma as condition, rapture dhamma arises, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… purejāte āsevane cha …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe purejāte āsevane cha pe avigate nava
translated: Nine in the cause … Nine in the object … Six in the prenascent … Six in the postnascent … Nine in the unarisen … Nine in the unarisen and in the presently arisen … Nine in the past and future … Nine in the past and present … Nine in the future and present … Nine in the past, future, and present.

original: Napītisahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca pītisahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na pīti sahagatam dhammam paṭicca pīti sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With non-happiness-accompanied dhamma as condition, happiness-accompanied dhamma arises, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… purejāte āsevane cha …pe… avigate nava.🔽Nasukhasahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sukhasahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… purejāte āsevane cha …pe… avigate nava.🔽Naupekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.

analyzed: na aupekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na aupekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā

analyzed: na aupekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ ca na aupekkhā sahagataḥ ca dhammā

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… aññamaññe cha …pe… purejāte āsevane dve …pe… avigate nava.

translated: With nine as root, four as object, five as dominant, … with six as prenascence, postnascence, and support, … with two as nutriment, two as faculty, and nine as non-hindrance.

translated: With an included as condition, five; with an object as condition, two … (in one way only).🔽With an unprompted as condition … (in one way only).🔽With an unprompted as condition, three …

original: Naaniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Naniyyānikañca naaniyyānikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: na aniyyānikam dhammam paṭicca aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na niyyānikam ca na aniyyānikam ca dhammam paṭicca aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe ekam pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: With an unprompted and an unprompted as condition … (in one way only).🔽With an included as condition, five; with an object as condition, one … (in one way only). With an object as condition, one … With a nutriment as condition, one … With an ignorance as condition, five … With an unprompted as condition, five.

original: Naniyataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca aniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: na niyatam dhammam paṭicca aniyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With an undetermined as condition, an undetermined … (in one way only).

original: Naaniyataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca aniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na aniyatam dhammam paṭicca aniyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an undetermined as condition, an undetermined … (in three ways).

original: Naniyatañca naaniyatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca aniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: na niyatam ca na aniyatam ca dhammam paṭicca aniyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: With an undetermined and an undetermined as condition, an undetermined … (as in § 1, above) … (The rest of the section is to be elaborated in detail as in § 1.)🔽With a cause as condition, five. With an object as condition, two … With nutriment as condition, one … With a faculty as condition, five.

original: Nasauttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasauttaraṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca anuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasauttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sauttaro
analyzed: na sauttaram dhammam paṭicca sauttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sauttaram dhamma  paṭicca anuttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa uttaram dhammam paṭicca sa uttaraḥ
translated: With a non-exalted as condition, an exalted …🔽With a non-exalted as condition, an unsurpassed …

original: ca anuttaro ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Naanuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: ca anuttaro ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  na anuttaram dhammam paṭicca sauttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With a non-exalted as condition, an exalted and an unsurpassed … three.🔽With a non-exalted as condition, an exalted … one.

original: Nasauttarañca naanuttarañca dhammaṁ paṭicca sauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sauttaram ca na anuttarañca dhammam paṭicca sauttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-exalted and a non-unsurpassed as condition, an exalted … (The rest of the section is to be elaborated in detail as in § 1.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca
translated: With a cause as condition, five. With an object as condition, two … With a faculty as condition, five.
